user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of create_response_object:
```c
static struct MHD_Response *
create_response_object (void)
{
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (body_dyn_size,
                                                   body_dyn);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_empty (MHD_RF_NONE);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                                 tiny_body);

#else  /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (body_dyn_size,
                                            (void *) body_dyn,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (0,
                                            (void *) tiny_body,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                          (void *) tiny_body,
                                          MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
#endif /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                          (void *) tiny_body,
                                          MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. The call does not use any function from <string.h> (it invokes MHD_create_response_from_buffer), so Rule 21.17 (which targets standard string.h functions such as memcpy/strlen/strcpy/etc.) is not applicable. Note: a separate safety issue could arise if MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(tiny_body) evaluates to a value greater than the actual storage of tiny_body (e.g. a misdefined macro), in which case MHD_create_response_from_buffer could read beyond the buffer — but that would not be a Rule 21.17 violation.
